Package fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.hyvarinenseppo.util

Class Arrays

java.lang.Object
fi.tuni.tamk.tiko.hyvarinenseppo.util.Arrays
public class Arrays
extends java.lang.Object
The Class Arrays contains several methods for maintaining and editing different types of Arrays as necessary.
Author:
Seppo Hyvarinen

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Arrays()  

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    static java.lang.String[] addZeroPrefix​(int[] array, int zeros)
    Converts an int[] array to String[] array and adds a desired amount of zeros as prefix to numbers.
    static boolean contains​(int value, int[] array)
    This boolean method compares the inserted int value to the int values in the inserted int[] array and returns true if the value is found in the array.
    static int containsSameValues​(int[] array1, int[] array2)
    Compares the int values in two int[] arrays and returns the amount of same values the arrays share Note: The method excpects that both int[] arrays contain only unique values!
    static int[] removeIndex​(int[] original, int index)
    Removes a wanted index from an int[] array.
    static int[] sort​(int[] array)
    Sorts an int[] array using selection sort to sort the array into ascending order.
    static int[] toIntArray​(java.lang.String[] array)
    Compiles and returns an int[] array from String[] array that is used as argument.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Arrays

      public Arrays()

  • Method Details

    • toIntArray

      public static int[] toIntArray​(java.lang.String[] array)
      Compiles and returns an int[] array from String[] array that is used as argument.
      Parameters:
      array - is the String[] array that is expected to be changed into int[] array
      Returns:
      returns an int[] array that is compiled from the String[] array.

    • contains

      public static boolean contains​(int value, int[] array)
      This boolean method compares the inserted int value to the int values in the inserted int[] array and returns true if the value is found in the array.
      Parameters:
      value - is the int value the method searches from an int[] array
      array - is the int[] array where the method searches the int value
      Returns:
      returns true if the value is found from the array, returns false if the value is not found from the arrays

    • containsSameValues

      public static int containsSameValues​(int[] array1, int[] array2)
      Compares the int values in two int[] arrays and returns the amount of same values the arrays share Note: The method excpects that both int[] arrays contain only unique values!
      Parameters:
      array1 - is the first of the int arrays used for comparing values.
      array2 - is the second of the int arrays used for comparing values.
      Returns:
      returns int value that is the sum of same int values found in the two arrays

    • removeIndex

      public static int[] removeIndex​(int[] original, int index)
      Removes a wanted index from an int[] array. The method creates a new int[] array containing all the values from the original array except the index that is wanted to be removed.
      Parameters:
      original - is the original int[] array we wish to have an index removed.
      index - is the index we want to remove from the int[] array
      Returns:
      returns the new int[] array which has the desired index removed.

    • sort

      public static int[] sort​(int[] array)
      Sorts an int[] array using selection sort to sort the array into ascending order.
      Parameters:
      array - is the array that will be sorted
      Returns:
      returns the sorted int[] array.

    • addZeroPrefix

      public static java.lang.String[] addZeroPrefix​(int[] array, int zeros)
      Converts an int[] array to String[] array and adds a desired amount of zeros as prefix to numbers. Parameter zeros amount determine the length of each element in the array. For example with the parameter zeros = 2, the output will be 02, 03, 04, 12, 15. With zeros = 3 output will be 001, 004, 012, 032, 134 etc.
      Parameters:
      array - is the int[] array we wish to convert to String[] array and add the prefixes to.
      zeros - determines the length of each element in the array ie. how many zero prefixes is desired to values under the amount.
      Returns:
      returns the prefixed String[] array.
